answers.answer: If he is quickly exhausted, I would suggest food that easily digests. Some foods really need a lot of energy to digest.What I would suggest beside eating healthy foods is:-take a nap when he feels like it-use energy only on those things that are worth the energy and not on some trivial things-do go so far with activities until he reaches a state of exhaustion, but try to stop well before that. It will be much easier and quicker to recuperate from that activity then.

question: My husband had a 5 bypass surgery in 2012 along with Stage 4 Hodgkins Lymphoma.  He was on Chemo for 6 months after the surgery.  We have been told he only has 30% heart function and nothing can be done because 4 of his 5 grafts have collapsed.  He now has Stage 4 prostate cancer and is going through hormone therapy.  He also has diabetes.  He is not a candidate for any surgery.  He is so tired and and can barely function on some days.  He tries to do a bit of work during the day but is exhausted by the end of the day.  Also has night sweats from the therapy, so sleep is interrupted.   He is 67 years old.  Any suggestion for some natural foods or vitamins or anything else that might help with the fatigue.
title: Stage 4 prostate cancer, 30% heart function & Type 2 diabetes.  Fatigue?
